abstract: The company that has given Apple’s iTunes the most competition in song downloading will now compete with it in selling audiobooks.
snippet: The company that has given Apple’s iTunes the most competition in song downloading will now compete with it in selling audiobooks.
lead_paragraph: The company that has given Apple’s iTunes the most competition in the song-download arena will now compete with it in selling audiobooks, too.

headline.main: EMusic, a Song-Download Site, to Offer Audiobooks
headline.print_headline: EMusic, a Song-Download Site, to Offer Audiobooks

lead_paragraph: The Advertising Club, New York, selected Bobby Shriver, who founded the organization Red with Bono, as its 2007 Advertising Person of the Year. He will be honored at a luncheon next Monday, the first day of Advertising Week 2007 in New York. Red teams up with companies like Apple and Gap to sell products that help raise money to fight AIDS in Africa. The luncheon will benefit the Advertising Club Foundation and a scholarship in Mr. Shriver’s name for an undergraduate student who wants to pursue a career in advertising.

abstract: Apple’s reportedly will announce deals to sell the iPhone in Europe this week. Carriers O2, Orange and T-Mobile are said to be giving huge portions of the usage fees back to Apple.
snippet: Apple’s reportedly will announce deals to sell the iPhone in Europe this week. Carriers O2, Orange and T-Mobile are said to be giving huge portions of the usage fees back to Apple.
lead_paragraph: Apple’s negotiations with carriers to bring the iPhone to Europe appear to have come to a head, with announcements scheduled for this week, according to published reports.

headline.main: The iPhone Heads to Europe; Euros Head to Cupertino
